meanings.sent1: The shiny object allured the curious cat.
meanings.sent2: The delicious smell of cookies allured the children to the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The promise of adventure allured the young explorers to set off on a journey.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious music allured her to the hidden garden.
meanings.sent5: The colorful poster allured passersby to attend the circus.

meanings.definition: To tempt or persuade someone to do something
meanings.sent1: The salesman allured customers with promises of huge discounts.
meanings.sent2: The peer pressure allured him into trying a risky stunt.
meanings.sent3: The aroma of freshly baked bread allured him to break his diet.
meanings.sent4: The idea of winning the competition allured her to practice harder.
meanings.sent5: The opportunity to travel allured him to accept the job offer.
